titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Gail Emma Asel was born in 1901. Asel received her A.B. from Park College, and did graduate work at Teacher's College of Columbia University and at the Union Theological Seminary. She was a missionary in the Punjab, beginning in 1930, and was the manager of the Forman Middle School for Girls in Lahore, 1931-1936.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of photos and slides from Gail Asel. Subjects include the Forman High School for Girls and the United Christian Hospital in Lahore (1931-1952); Mission Girls School and Mission Hospital in Ambala City (1946-1948); Kasur Girls School (1953-1966); and village scenes in Pakistan. The collection also includes a few slides possibly taken in Kansas. The photos and slides depict scenes in India, of staff and students at mission schools and hospitals, village scenes, and vacations in the hills.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
